text: Kagemasa Kōzuki (上月 景正, Kōzuki Kagemasa, 12 November 1940) is a Japanese industrialist. He is the founder and chairman of Konami, a Japanese entertainment company. He is also known as Kaz Kozuki. == Career == Kagemasa Kōzuki founded Konami Industry Co., Ltd. in 1969. The company began making amusement machines for arcades in 1973. Category:1940 births Category:Japanese businesspeople
title: Kagemasa Kōzuki
